Description: Cul sherd (mended from two fragments) of Attic black-figured pottery kantharos; interior glazed black with narrow added red band; exterior: part of incised palmette with alternating red and black fronds, red heart, red collar with red dot below; below, part of adjoining opposed palmette volutes with red collars and red triangles; three concentric black bands and part of dot band (two rows of dots).
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1914,0317.7, 1965,0930.795 and 1965,0930.797.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 357, no. B459)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 235, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0742) (Phase 1)
